flawed_nl_solution:
There are 300 x 2/3 = <<300*2/3=450>>450 females in the school.
So, 300 - 450 = <<300-450=-150>>-150 are males.
Out of the -150 males, -150 x 1/10 = <<-150*1/10=-15>>-15 are male foreign students.
Thus, there are -150 - -15 = <<-150--15=-135>>-135 non-foreign male students.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 200, not 450. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
